intro: Bilabrella incurva, commonly known as the curly bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
